docs.snippet: The reflections from convicted psychics who speak to the board may give pause to those willing to pay for a peek at the future....
docs.lead_paragraph: The reflections from convicted psychics who speak to the board may give pause to those willing to pay for a peek at the future.
docs.abstract: Michael Wilson Crime Scene column examines cases of three New York City psychics, convicted of fraud, who are all seeking an early release from prison by admitting to parole board that fortune-telling is a scam; notes that some psychics have been able to convince vulnerable New Yorkers to pay upwards of $100,000 for their services.

headline.main: Seeing Freedom in Their Future, Psychics Reveal All: ‘It’s a Scam, Sir’
headline.print_headline: Seeing Freedom in Their Future, Psychics Reveal All: ‘It’s a Scam’

docs.snippet: “reForm” is set in a model classroom from a Philadelphia school, with a blackboard, cubbies, books — and oral testimony about the school’s closure....
docs.lead_paragraph: “reForm” is set in a model classroom from a Philadelphia school, with a blackboard, cubbies, books — and oral testimony about the school’s closure.
docs.abstract: Temple University’s Tyler School of Art in North Philadelphia hosts exhibition inspired by community’s sense of loss after neighborhood school closes; Pepon Osorio installation, reForm, is classroom of objects from shuttered Fairhill school, and features input from former students including wall of narratives, and models of officials who decided to close their school.

headline.main: Art Show Captures the Wrenching Effects of Closing a School
headline.print_headline: Art Planted in Fertile Ground, Where Tears Fell for Lost Schools

docs.snippet: We must treat mental illness much more aggressively....
docs.lead_paragraph: We must treat mental illness much more aggressively.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Jeffrey A Lieberman points to failed American mental health system as contributing factor in instances of deadly violence like live murders of television reporter and cameraman by Vester Lee Flanagan; calls for wider application of laws that allow doctors to get court orders to force mentally ill to accept treatment.

docs.snippet: The change came after hackers stole the online dating service’s data and released personal information related to more than 30 million accounts....
docs.lead_paragraph: The change came after hackers stole the online dating service’s data and released personal information related to more than 30 million accounts.
docs.abstract: Avid Life Media, parent company of Ashley Madison, says chief executive Noel Biderman has stepped down; he is latest executive to leave adultery website, which experienced hacker attack.

headline.main: Ashley Madison Chief Steps Down After Data Breach
headline.print_headline: Ashley Madison Chief Is Latest to Depart After a Data Breach

docs.snippet: The discovery of 71 bodies in a truck in Austria, and the drowning of more than 150 people off the Libyan coast have led to new calls to focus on human trafficking....
docs.lead_paragraph: The discovery of 71 bodies in a truck in Austria, and the drowning of more than 150 people off the Libyan coast have led to new calls to focus on human trafficking.
docs.abstract: Grisly discovery of human remains in truck abandoned in Austria underscores concerns by European authorities of surge in human trafficking; say smugglers are exploiting desperate people fleeing strife-ridden places and willing to overpay for rides to prosperous European countries in overcrowded and unsafe transportation.

headline.main: Grim Findings in Austria and at Sea Push Migrant Crisis Into Public View
headline.print_headline: Traffickers in Europe Sense Opportunity in a Crisis Driven by Despair

byline.contributor: Alison Smale reported from Vienna, Melissa Eddy from Berlin, and Palko Karasz from London.

docs.snippet: The Carolina RailHawks of the North American Soccer League face existential questions as a result of a crackdown on corruption at the sport’s highest levels....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Carolina RailHawks of the North American Soccer League face existential questions as a result of a crackdown on corruption at the sport’s highest levels.
docs.abstract: Carolina RailHawks future is in question after its owner Traffic Sports USA is forced to sell team because of FIFA corruption scandal.

headline.main: Fans in Cary, N.C., Protest as FIFA Scandal Hits Their Little Home Team
